en.title: Complete Guide to Cat Body Language: Reading Tail, Ears, and Posture
en.content:
Cats communicate their feelings through body language instead of words. By learning to read these signals, you can build a better relationship with your cat.

Tail Language

Tail held high while approaching you = happy, greeting. Slow swaying = relaxed. Rapid thrashing = irritated or excited. Puffed up = frightened or defensive. Tucked between legs = fearful or anxious.

Ear Language

Facing forward = interested or relaxed. Flattened sideways ("airplane ears") = uneasy or irritated. Pinned back = frightened or preparing to attack. Swiveling around = alert and scanning.

Body Posture

Belly exposed = trust (though some cats may still dislike belly touches). Back arched with fur standing on end = frightened. Slow blinking = expression of affection. Head rubbing against you = scent marking combined with affection.

zh.title: 猫咪肢体语言完全指南：通过尾巴、耳朵和姿势读懂猫的心情
zh.content:
猫咪用肢体语言代替言语来传达情绪。学会解读这些信号，能让你和猫咪的关系更加亲密。

尾巴的语言

竖直尾巴向你走来→开心、打招呼。缓慢摇摆→放松。剧烈甩动→烦躁或兴奋。炸毛→恐惧或威吓。夹在两腿之间→恐惧或不安。

耳朵的语言

朝前→感兴趣或放松。向两侧倒（"飞机耳"）→不安或烦躁。向后压平→恐惧或准备攻击。不停转动→警惕。

身体姿势

露出肚子→信任（但有些猫被摸肚子会生气）。弓背炸毛→恐惧。缓慢眨眼→爱的表达。用头蹭你→气味标记加上表达喜爱。
